poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: He took the sun and swung it Round his heid and slung it Owre the low hills west of Langholm. What makars did back then! The other stars Trummelt till his rant was sung to silence. It might have been meningitis, ken, His spinal cord high strung at best And something to stun or astonish his system Stung him. He'd sprung a leak, spun out of line.
